a.g: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allah dispensed [with them]; and Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy."
So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Qur'an which We have sent down. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.
No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
Allah - there is no deity except Him. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
O you who have believed, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
اعلم ان جميع ما يلقى العبد في هذه الحياة لا يخلو من نوعين احدهما هو الذي يوافق هواه والاخر هو الذي لا يوافقه بل يكرهه وهو محتاج الى الصبر في كل واحد منهما وهو في جميع الاحوال لا يخلو عن احد هذين النوعين او عن كليهما فهو إذن لا يستغنى قط عن الصبر. النوع الأول: ما يوافق الهوى وهو الصحة والسلامة والمال والجاه وكثرة العشيرة واتساع الاسباب وكثرة الأتباع والأنصار وجميع ملاذ الدنيا وما احوج العبد الى الصبر على هذه الأمور فإنه ان لم يضبط نفسه عن الاسترسال والركون اليها والانهماك في ملاذها المباحة منها أخرجه ذلك الى البطر والطغيان فإن الإنسان ليطغى ان رآه استغنى حتى قال بعض العارفين: البلاء يصبر عليه المؤمن والعوافي لا يصبر عليها الا صديق. وقال سهل: الصبر على العافية اشد من الصبر على البلاء ولما فتحت ابواب الدنيا على الصحابة رضي الله عنهم قالوا ابتلينا بفتنة الضراء فصبرنا وابتلينا بفتنة السراء فلم نصبر ولذلك حذر الله عباده من فتنة المال والزوج والولد فقال تعالى: ﴿ يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تلهكم أموالكم ولا أولادكم عن ذكر الله ﴾ {} وقال عز وجل: ﴿ ان من أزواجكم وأولادكم عدوا لكم فاحذروهم ﴾ {} وقال ﭬ: (الولد مبخلة مجبنة محزنة[19]). (ولما نظر عليه السلام الى ولده الحسن رضي الله عنه يتعثر في قميصه نزل عن المنبر واحتضنه ثم قال صدق الله ﴿ إنما اموالكم واولادكم فتنة ﴾ {} اني لما رأيت ابني يتعثر لم املك نفسي ان اخذته[20]) ففي ذلك عبرة لأولى الأبصار فالرجل كل الرجل من يصبر على العافية ومعنى الصبر عليها ان لا يركن اليها ويعلم ان كل ذلك مستودع عنده وعسى ان يسترجع على القرب وان لا يرسل نفسه في الفرح بها ولا ينهمك في التنعم واللذة واللهو واللعب وان يرعى حقوق الله في ماله بالإنفاق وفي بدنه ببذل المعونة للخلق وفي لسانه ببذل الصدق وكذلك في سائر ما انعم الله به عليه وهذا الصبر متصل بالشكر فلا يتم الا بالقيام بحق الشكر كما سيأتي وانما كان الصبر على السراء اشد لأنه مقرون بالقدرة ومن العصمة ان لا تقدر والصبر على الحجامة والقصد اذا تولاه غيرك أيسر من الصبر على فصدك نفسك وحجامتك نفسك والجائع عند غيبة الطعام اقدر على الصبر منه اذا حضرته الأطعمة الطيبة اللذيذه وقدر عليها فلهذا عظمت فتنة السراء.
Know that all that befalls the servant [al-'abd] in this life is not free from two types. The first is that which conforms to his desire [hawa], and the other is that which does not conform to it, but rather he dislikes it. And he is in need of patience [sabr] in each one of them. And in all states, he is not free from one of these two types or from both of them. He is, therefore, never independent of patience. **The First Type:** That which conforms to desire [hawa], and it is health, safety, wealth, status, numerous kin, ample means, many followers and supporters, and all the pleasures of the world [dunya]. And how greatly the servant [al-'abd] is in need of patience regarding these matters! For if he does not restrain himself from indulging freely, relying upon them, and immersing himself in their pleasures—even the permissible ones—that will lead him to insolence and transgression. For indeed, man becomes insolent when he sees himself self-sufficient. So much so that one of the knowers [al-'arifun] said: "The believer can be patient with affliction, but only the truthful [siddiq] can be patient with well-being [al-'awafi]." And Sahl said: "Patience [sabr] with well-being ['afiya] is more severe than patience with affliction." And when the doors of the world [dunya] were opened upon the Companions, may God be pleased with them, they said: "We were tested with the trial of hardship, and we were patient; then we were tested with the trial of ease, and we were not patient." And for this reason, God warned His servants of the trial of wealth, spouse, and children, so He, the Exalted, said: {O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of God} [63:9]. And He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: {Indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them} [64:14]. And He, peace be upon him, said: "A child is a source of miserliness, cowardice, and grief." (And when he, peace be upon him, saw his son al-Hasan, may God be pleased with him, stumbling in his shirt, he descended from the pulpit, embraced him, and then said: "God has spoken the truth: {Your wealth and your children are but a trial} [8:28]. Indeed, when I saw my son stumbling, I could not restrain myself from taking him.") In that is a lesson for those of insight [ulu al-absar]. The true man, the complete man, is he who is patient with well-being ['afiya]. And the meaning of patience with it is that he does not rely upon it, and knows that all of that is a trust deposited with him, and it is likely to be reclaimed soon; and that he does not let himself go in rejoicing over it, nor immerse himself in enjoyment, pleasure, amusement, and play; and that he observes the rights of God regarding his wealth by spending, regarding his body by offering help to creation, regarding his tongue by offering truthfulness, and likewise in all that God has bestowed upon him. And this patience is connected to gratitude [shukr]; it is not complete except by fulfilling the right of gratitude, as will come. And patience with ease [al-sarra'] was only more severe because it is coupled with capability, and part of being protected [al-'ismah] is not having capability. Patience with cupping and bloodletting when someone else performs it on you is easier than patience with you performing bloodletting and cupping on yourself. The hungry person in the absence of food is more capable of patience than when delicious, pleasant foods are present before him and he has power over them. For this reason, the trial of ease [fitnat al-sarra'] is great.

a.g: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allah has with Him a great reward.

For if he does not restrain himself from indulging freely, from relying upon them, and from immersing himself in their pleasures—even the permissible ones—that will lead him to arrogance [batr] and transgression [tughyan]. For indeed, man becomes transgressing when he sees himself self-sufficient. And Sahl said: "Patience [sabr] upon well-being ['afiya] is more severe than patience upon affliction [bala']." And when the doors of the world [dunya] were opened upon the Companions, may God be pleased with them, they said: "We were tested with the trial of hardship [fitnat al-darra'], so we were patient. And we were tested with the trial of ease [fitnat al-sarra'], and we were not patient." And for this reason, God warned His servants from the trial of wealth, spouse, and children, saying, the Exalted: {O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of God} [63:9]. The hungry person in the absence of food is more capable of patience than when delicious, pleasant foods are present before him and he has power over them. For this reason, the trial of ease [fitnat al-sarra'] is immense.

a.g: So fear Allah as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allah]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
If you loan Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is Most Appreciative and Forbearing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وهو خلق من اخلاق الربوبية اذ قال تعالى: ﴿ والله شكور حليم ﴾ {}
Indeed, it is a trait from the traits of Lordship [Rububiyyah], for the Exalted has said: "And Allah is Appreciative [Shakur], Forbearing [Halim]."

a.g: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
